title: Scottish Labour leader reveals she made secret Brexit pledge to Nicola Sturgeon
text:
Scottish Labour leader reveals she made secret Brexit pledge to Nicola Sturgeon Scottish Labour leader reveals she made secret Brexit pledge to Nicola Sturgeon SCOTTISH LABOUR leader Kezia Dugdale has revealed she made a secret pledge with Nicola Sturgeon to support the SNP’s Brexit plans in the days after the EU referendum. PUBLISHED: 16:25, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 16:42, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 
Ms Sturgeon has demanded Scotland be allowed to remain in the EU’s Single Market and retain free movement as part of a “differentiated” Brexit deal to the rest of the UK. 
And it has now emerged the First Minister won the backing of her political rival Ms Dugdale in the immediate aftermath of the Leave result. PA Kezia Dugdale held talks with Nicola Sturgeon in the immediate aftermath of the Brexit vote Related articles Minister fails to answer questions on '£1m compo to Brit ISIS bomber' 
In an interview with The Times , the Scottish Labour leader described how she and SNP rival Ms Sturgeon “talked at length about how horrified we were at the result of the referendum” following the Brexit vote. 
Ms Dugdale said: “I pledged at that point to do everything I could, with the powers I had, to support Scotland having as strong a relationship with the rest of Europe as possible. 
“And the flipside of that was if you want our support you have to be transparent and open with us, privately or otherwise, about how that can be done. 
“And that is how we embarked from July onwards.” Brexit: Which parts of the UK had the majority vote? Fri, February 17, 2017 Much of the North East of the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union including Sunderland, Gateshead, Darlington, Durham, Hartlepool, Middlesbrough, Stockton, Redcar and Cleveland, North Tyneside and South Tyneside, and Northumberland. Newcastle was the only borough to vote to remain. Getty Images 1 of 8 GREAT YARMOUTH: The town of Great Yarmouth on the East Coast of England voted by 72% to leave the European Union. We talked at length about how horrified we were at the result of the referendum Kezia Dugdale 
Earlier this month, Labour MSPs joined the SNP by voting in favour of a symbolic Scottish Parliament motion rejecting the triggering of Article 50. 
This was in defiance of national leader Jeremy Corbyn’s position at Westminster, who ordered his MPs to vote in favour of beginning EU divorce talks in the House of Commons. 
Mr Corbyn has also spoken of rejecting key parts of the Single Market, despite aiming to retain “full access”. 
The SNP have used last summer’s Brexit vote to consistently threaten a second Scottish independence referendum. 
Ms Dugdale warned Theresa May against allowing Ms Sturgeon to “ramp up the grievance” if she fails to hand over powers returned from Brussels to Holyrood. 
She said: “If tomorrow [Mrs May] was to say no more powers, no more money, all she would succeed in doing would be to give the SNP another reason to offer a grievance. 
“Nicola Sturgeon is grabbing every opportunity she can to ramp up the grievance and the demand for a second independence referendum.” 
Ms Dugdale has called for a new Act of Union to save the UK from Scottish independence, including proposals to be drawn up for a federal UK. Related articles
